title: TAJ MAHAL - 70's swash display type - font ID
content:
Looking for an ID on the 70's style swashy script display type used on the first Taj Mahal LP.

Many thanks in advance,  
Danny

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725010734im_/http:/typophile.com/files/taj-mahal-first-album_4423.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [taj-mahal-first-album.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725010734/http:/typophile.com/files/taj-mahal-first-album.jpg) | 136.62 KB |
author: Danny_Miller

comments.content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725010734im_/http:/typophile.com/files/UnknownFunkyScript1967_4472.jpg)
  
These funky letters from 1967 reminded me of fonts like Jezebel [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/jezebel/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725010734/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/jezebel/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/jezebel/") Julia Script [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/julia-script/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725010734/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/julia-script/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/julia-script/") Candice [http://www.myfonts.com/search/candice/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725010734/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/candice/fonts/ "http://www.myfonts.com/search/candice/fonts/") Charade [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/profonts/charade/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725010734/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/profonts/charade/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/profonts/charade/") Casey [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/casey/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725010734/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/casey/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/casey/") but none are an exact fit.  
Don
